item.title: Learning Kubernetes Controllers
item.description: Kubernetes’ extensibility is probably its biggest strength. Controllers and CRDs are all over the place. But finding the right information to begin writing a controller isn’t easy due to the sheer amount of tribal knowledge scattered everywhere. This post intends to help you start with controllers. Let us begin with some terminology: when I say “controller” (singular noun), I mean one single loop that watches some objects. I often call this loop “controller loop” or “sync loop” or even “reconcile loop”.
